text.0: We are glad to welcome our newest Deputy Editor! https://t.co/KAYBJSk5KZ
text.1: Esophageal motility disorders & esophageal reflux are common, causing compromised quality of life. Improvements in diagnosis & treatment have enhanced the management of disorders.
text.2: "Why I Wore All Black That Day": Dr. Sneha Shah describes how mourning the death of Ruth Bader Ginsburg taught her about mourning patients who have died and allowing herself to feel negative' emotions. New post from Insights on Residency Training blog: https://t.co/FoYqclaqfh https://t.co/l6wq7BT3Wj
text.3: Participants without cardiovascular disease who were at increased risk were randomly assigned a polypill or placebo and to receive aspirin or placebo. At 4.6 years, the incidence of cardiovascular events was lower among participants receiving both the polypill and aspirin. #AHA20
text.4: Among patients with heart failure & a reduced ejection fraction, those who received the cardiac myosin activator omecamtiv mecarbil had a lower incidences of heart-failure events or cardiovascular death at a median of 22 months than those who received placebo. #AHA20
text.5: A 59-year-old woman with type 1 diabetes and a 2-year history of cognitive decline presented with obtundation, with diffuse, symmetric hypointensity in the brain on T2-weigh images, and abnormal susceptibility signals. A diagnostic test was performed.
text.6: Patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis were randomly assigned to receive subcutaneous semaglutide or placebo. The incidence of NASH resolution was significantly higher with semaglutide than with placebo. #LiverMtg20
text.7: A validated model with electronic-medical-record data, identifying high risk, clinical deterioration patients, showed decrease by remote nurses, when communicating with rapid-response teams.
